NOTES: (yuz: Yurakaré) original source uses /ɹ̝/ and describes as "voiced post-alveolar fricative". There is a footnote to this description that is missing from the document. how is apical ʒ different from ʐ ? Mail sent to author of original source document.

(cbr: Cashibo-Cacataibo) downtack on a fricative = an approximant, should use /w/?  update: This is the only /w/-like sound in this language, and this is the only language in SAPHON using this phoneme. Nonetheless, still not using /w/ due to its velar place features. Original transcription retained.
